page.title: 01Albury Heath & Farley Heath
page.content: The valley of the Lawbrook divides the uplands of Albury Heath and Farley Heath. This is a rural green belt area, west of Guildford, of heathlands, woods, farmland and hamlets. It is good horse riding and walking country, and many horses and ponies are kept. Most people commute to work in London; the Reading/ Torbridge railway passes through but does not stop, so people drive to Clardon on the Guildford-Waterloo line. People are very mobile and houses change hands frequently; small houses are enlarged but few new houses have been built. Mainly in Albury Parish, partly in Shore, the area still has a church and a pub, but Brook shop and the school closed recently and there are few buses to Guildford now. Most of the farming is market gardens, with a few animals;
